title: Compare Q and K for change in [CO2]

content.description:
A mixture of <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, and <math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is placed in a previously evacuated, rigid container, and the mixture reacts according to the following equation.

<math alttext="C O gas plus H 2 O gas is in equilibrium with C O 2 gas plus H 2 gas. K sub p equals 100 at 500 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>at 500 K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

The initial partial pressures are given in the table.

Substance
 Initial Partial Pressure (<math alttext="in atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)

<math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="6.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="1.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following predicts what will happen to the concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as the system approaches equilibrium at <math alttext="500 kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>500</mn> <mo>⁢</mo> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>K</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, with justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase because <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase because <math alttext="Q is less than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because <math alttext="Q is less than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
